D8C3AB78E3894293AEAB590B1165B18E.description: demonstrate appropriate strategies to provide feedback that is a positive reflection of a presentation and/or encourages the presenter and audience to consider other ideas and additional information; e.g., I like it when you said ..., you may want to consider ...

FF2F50ABED3A4719ACB15B70494CE6F0.description: use appropriate criteria and teamwork tools to assess and monitor group processes; e.g., checklists, role descriptors, flow charts, discussion and questions

B7285BDC99484BF8AC7F098F9BDEEDF4.description: engage in effective evaluations by realizing the importance of tact, honesty and specificity in peer and self-evaluation

526EB134D8DD40C496E9E9ADCE0E84C7.description: identify and apply appropriate leadership styles to motivate a group; e.g., be cooperative and supportive and use appropriate problem-solving strategies

D264BC6E00204FDAA861DCF2F5D250C4.description: recognize the various roles and responsibilities of group members, e.g., recorder, chair, Elder and coworker, and appreciate the contribution that these roles make to the group process

B5309571C26D4F1EA88E6C6CD3239291.description: demonstrate listening and other appropriate behaviours within a group; e.g., listen without interrupting, focus on the speaker, contribute to be heard, disagree courteously, accept conflicting opinions, show respect for the rights and values of others

F590131F36F74746A2512481193D2893.description: assess the results and, based on new information, re-evaluate the conflict resolution model and solution

C81BF86C5FB848A7B4A1C8D58E3D2A3D.description: assess the effectiveness of group contributions to facilitate the completion of group goals

560098D7390649DC8CABD01D4455C4D7.description: interact and communicate with others in a positive manner, by considering appropriate dress, space and conversational skills; e.g., when in a job interview, when communicating with a customer or coworker

3656E6CB88CB45E9B477E366B5F18917.description: demonstrate respect for, and assess and defend, individual rights and differences in themselves and others, within a group or a community, in a positive and constructive manner; e.g., be fair and honest, demonstrate integrity and personal ethics

8A2570801B474F038C16BF8C87B2F003.description: set appropriate personal goals for participation in a group, e.g., demonstrate respect and be open to and supportive of the thoughts, opinions and contributions of others, and share personal knowledge, expertise and perspectives, as appropriate

8FC2132CF398426EB1ABF5F1F1624AF3.description: Cooperate with others and contribute to group processes

A725BE5B8E694AF0881D6AA1B927DBDC.description: identify the formal and informal ways in which language and image are used appropriately to honour and/or recognize people and celebrate events; e.g., a toast, eulogy, poster and thank-you card

8BC42D2573A2415295C1297353A6CD6F.description: use language and image to honour and/or recognize their own and others' accomplishments; e.g., construct e-mail and other messages conveying congratulations, thank-you notes

9CE7611C777E428D92665CD1EFC703FF.description: examine the ways in which selected works of literature, and other print and nonprint texts, influence individual and group values and behaviours

B350B41B8D3F4503A558F377FD6D6A0C.description: demonstrate an appreciation for diversity of thought and expression and select, monitor and modify, as needed, appropriate strategies for appreciating diversity

BD7B5104094546A48E53964AEBE87F45.description: recognize and demonstrate respect for diversity, individual differences and perspectives

6EBE7C27F6FF4652AEC1721C6A1BCB70.description: Appreciate diversity of expression, opinion and perspective

B66FE3C1A0A2481895F95C7CB9CB3305.description: monitor the use of verbal and nonverbal communication to convey inclusion, respect and consideration

16EAA00C13754F4697456DDA5FD84FA0.description: differentiate between constructive criticism and ridicule, and between irony and sarcasm, and use appropriate strategies to show respect

C49DCC6E7D7B4115A54F9DB92F22B1D3.description: recognize positive and negative portrayals of persons in life and characters in literature and demonstrate sensitivity to the feelings of others

4DFD926C92924E3B832B1F0DA9BDAED7.description: use inclusive language and behaviour and communicate or create texts in ways that demonstrate respect for people of different heritage, cultures, genders, ages, abilities, opinions and communities, including aboriginal people and communities

0E46AD60E3D449C7A59F3D4989C69450.description: Use language and image to show respect and consideration

A3ECB389B6134F9B8D38AA833B3BAF79.description: Respect themselves and others and strengthen community

1B8B61969D27444791B2F37FC5A57395.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to respect, support and collaborate with others.

E21829BDB5BE49E3BE2269980C54045C.description: recognize that certain communication situations demand particular attention to correctness of punctuation, spelling, grammar, usage and sentence construction; e.g., résumés, application forms and letters, job interviews

8F0210977FEB4224BDFB3BE199B2694B.description: identify the parts of speech in their own and others' texts, e.g., nouns, pronouns, verbs, adjectives and adverbs, to ensure correct subject-verb agreement, pronoun use and sentence structure

F4904FEFDF774ADD8F805676A4B77ABA.description: identify parts of sentences and common sentence structures, e.g., simple, compound and complex, and use transitional devices, as appropriate, to correct common errors in sentences; e.g., run-on sentences and fragments

97C3C1E9080E49958D7B209FF3D8DACE.description: apply basic capitalization, punctuation and spelling conventions, using appropriate tools; e.g., dictionaries, handbooks and spelling software/technology

61B5DFC61FDC45E4A848A9654C41BFC4.description: revise texts to ensure clarity and coherence; e.g., editing for punctuation, spelling, usage, grammar, sentence structure, paragraph transitions, transitional devices, style and vocabulary

EAD106B3404F41B0BE5E458E436B3175.description: use appropriate tools to assist in creating and revising text; e.g., handbooks, exemplars, models, dictionaries and spell checks/grammar checks on word processors

2EE8E0C6F0E748F9945DEFD77D2B3CD0.description: Edit text for matters of correctness

29EED4A78E4443C8971F907D5434B46C.description: demonstrate self-direction, self-discipline and the ability to work independently and effectively to improve products and/or presentations

4B228E30FAA04D95BBBCF4C6E885125E.description: select and use the effective techniques, elements and matters of choice appropriate to the purpose, audience and medium; e.g., vocabulary, expressions, sentence patterns and structures, illustrations, artwork and Internet links

32589AF79FD84432A9D570904F12503E.description: Consider and address matters of choice

0D85D8EACB1C41A88E5D59322747A231.description: manipulate graphics and text to effectively communicate a topic

B8C8899ACB63471FA1843DBB1A3F51E3.description: assess the closing of a text in progress and revise as needed to consider plan, purpose, audience and medium and to ensure an appropriate conclusion

0765A985B06B4C4AA2BB778825B52AFB.description: review the organizational components of a text in progress to strengthen the effectiveness of the components as units of thought or experience; e.g., paragraphs in a letter of application, components of a résumés or sections/slides in a multimedia presentation

EA996B5EAEA8446795A789A802D42B04.description: assess the beginning of a text in progress and revise as needed to consider the plan, purpose, audience and medium

D0AE7350C90D47E087A0FD7927890513.description: create, enhance and evaluate the effectiveness of a variety of presentation forms; e.g., written/oral reports, posters, multimedia presentations, charts, collages, cartoons and Web pages

1E781100EEA64DB79D67DF21E7AB39AB.description: demonstrate responsibility for following appropriate security and safety measures when using technology and the Internet; e.g., use appropriate language and etiquette, apply ergonomics to promote personal health and well-being and respect the products and privacy of others

5A919B39369C41659976FAAE5AD17E1E.description: review the accuracy and specificity of details, events, images, facts and other data intended to support a focus, controlling idea or issue and add information to support/develop as needed

EE39735A62624A8FBEDABFFAD9097494.description: confirm the controlling idea or desired unifying effect of a text

899A31FA969B46E1BDF135D5201526A7.description: Enhance thought, understanding, support and detail

B4C5054563354D35A95162F792ABEB06.description: Improve thoughtfulness, effectiveness and correctness of communication

032C77CDF8D3473F85F2A943D1B03764.description: use a consistent style when crediting sources of information in a bibliography and in footnotes

78917093977544AC8EBF8B87C90386A3.description: demonstrate a moral and ethical approach in the use of graphics, text and multimedia in presentations by citing sources as appropriate

D8969FB5B05540A98FDF707DB107B59F.description: demonstrate appropriate keyboarding techniques, e.g., use proper fingering when using alphabet and punctuation keys, and use a variety of strategies to increase keyboarding speed and accuracy

1D742ECD3AAE4A24AC52E04E7FA562B4.description: control aspects of style, e.g., font, size, style, colour, spacing of text, image placement, sound and video links, within the presentation form or product for consistency and/or to convey meaning

BADFB25237A14D3FACA7F952E3C4A17C.description: develop and deliver oral, visual and multimedia presentations, using voice production factors, nonverbal factors, e.g., tone, volume, eye contact, gestures and posture, and visual production factors, e.g., colour, contrast and movement, appropriate to the purpose, audience and situation

18D03A4F9572495DA3BCAAE1E5B79632.description: create presentations by integrating information gathered from various sources; e.g., use various audio and visual technologies and a variety of software, applying appropriate common conventions

85EFE83C17FA40E9A6CE2E0E9B77C1CB.description: create presentations and select strategies and technologies appropriate to the environment, purpose, audience and form and recognize the need for preparedness in effective communication

13917312559440EBB8CFFAEFF40F9460.description: Use production, publication and presentation strategies and technologies consistent with context

7E4ECB4BDF434F3692E15C78A5432D18.description: create a variety of print, oral, visual and/or multimedia texts that reflect a controlling idea, focus, purpose and audience, including: functional writing, e.g., an advertisement for a newspaper, résumés, cover letter, business letter, using electronic templates as appropriate, real and/or sample home- and work-related forms using a variety of resources; e.g., Social Insurance Number (SIN) form, template on Human Resources Development Canada (HRDC) Web site, job application, bank account application and income tax template, computer-generated and/or other presentations to demonstrate the interview process, workplace task(s) and/or to provide other information and narrative, descriptive, persuasive and expository paragraphs and three- to five-paragraph essays appropriate to language growth for home, community and workplace applications

59F3AEE155EE4351B8BB2F8D162B88EC.description: apply appropriate prewriting strategies, e.g., graphic organizers and technology, as appropriate, discussion, brainstorms, webs, outlines, journals and notes, to explore, develop and support their own and new ideas, opinions and points of view

A1348D8387D944D6951185E45042E16A.description: create content appropriate to the purpose, audience, situation and medium and incorporate appropriate examples from their personal experience

2251E2D407E642518A80F07B53980192.description: take ownership of their text creation by selecting or crafting a topic, concept or idea that is personally meaningful and engaging

396452447E43463DBD602D89F12CBBD3.description: apply common conventions when creating oral, print, visual and multimedia texts; e.g., volume of a multimedia presentation; format of letters, memorandums and e-mail messages; structure of a résumés

03CE040A73204F4981126ADD989C0463.description: use a medium appropriate to the content and context; e.g., television advertisement targeting specific audiences such as youth, men or women

6B8EAE667EEE403ABC5C20DF118624B4.description: use structures consistent with the form, content and purpose; e.g., chronological order when creating a résumés, narrative or historical timeline; videotape an interview with a member of the business community or an employer

C403E105683E4CAEA15F8F4E04415B25.description: select a text form consistent with the purpose and content; e.g., photo essay in their career portfolio that includes work experience and other community partnerships

D994005287BC4D379091378852AD986D.description: Consider and address form, structure and medium

221EDA02730D4CECA32B0F7ACFFFDC2B.description: recognize that the depth and breadth of content will affect the format, structure and medium

E2C75D66F3214EF79402B315CF5266E9.description: identify the expectations and constraints of a communication; e.g., format, standards of quality, availability of resources and time

6C25FF4119B24288914A03AAF9905DCE.description: consider the audience factors that affect text creation; e.g., age, gender, audience size and proximity, culture and positions of authority

2812F9E3C2A948DD95AAFE95C3BA5BB6.description: determine the purpose for text creation; e.g., to inform, explain, persuade, build relationships or entertain

3019A959807F4B88AC239FE278A9FF4B.description: Develop and present a variety of print and nonprint texts

4164E26F18C549008A669834FE9EFAA0.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to create oral, print, visual and multimedia texts and enhance the clarity and artistry of communication.

90AFD17A60AB4F03B31CC99811F9586C.description: develop a plan to enhance the craftsmanship and accuracy of current and future work and celebrate and take pride in their efforts and accomplishments

7C2A1547F7BF4B1B82DD2C0B926CE3E4.description: review the appropriateness, accuracy and significance of findings, conclusions and generalizations

6752477453FB4C5BA8961D842EE3522D.description: evaluate the effectiveness of the strategies used to guide the research process and identify strategies to improve future research

D79F016D4EE74FBFA7713514EE91C02C.description: Review inquiry or research process and findings

A783AC0B0DB842E292E63A344D382DAA.description: use appropriate strategies, e.g., cause and effect, pros and cons, plus/minus/interesting (PMI), storyboards and Venn diagrams, when analyzing, synthesizing and evaluating information to draw conclusions or form generalizations

0F1B4A01F5174731802A9F46FBB933E8.description: draw conclusions that are appropriate to their findings, reflect their own understandings and are consistent with the topic, purpose and situation

B44E3A2605254D048DFB2F8CF5557EB1.description: distinguish between support and generalization and provide evidence for generalizations and conclusions

1395099E9D1B4EC1ACED75B6518E74EA.description: form generalizations by integrating new information with prior knowledge

A5FA81F00F4D4B5282CC5FC496A4B719.description: identify multiple viewpoints and evaluate the relevancy, quality, credibility and bias of sources and information

B0C5B7F3F43C409EB6E56305EB8B4103.description: assess whether the information gathered is reliable, complete, current and significant to determine its usefulness to the overall purpose, audience and form of the presentation

CF136DD3353447D8AFCDCCA0099E5512.description: assess whether information sources are credible and appropriate to the purpose, audience and form of the presentation

B388B6E75DC54802B450BD3A1F343C0F.description: apply guidelines for Internet use; e.g., confidentiality, respect copyright and use rules for citing sources

434072BF4B294118A8790ABF27054701.description: record information accurately and completely, using a consistent and appropriate style

0983DC554AD34E7BBE1198343DBFD7A2.description: use and manage a variety of oral, print, visual and multimedia resources appropriate to a topic; e.g., textbooks, books, encyclopedias, graphs, diagrams, posters, pictures, films, databases, CD-ROMs, Web sites and the Internet

557FB284C28A43DBB5BC134A94F39271.description: identify and/or develop appropriate details to support the focus of an inquiry, using a variety of strategies; e.g., map/webs, graphic organizers and outlines

C36CFDB151D048CFB449B73253A7F005.description: use a variety of strategies to organize and record information; e.g., take notes in point form, outlines, webs, categorize and guide questions

23ED90D2652E4DC4A24356A9E3C74EBB.description: select information and support materials appropriate to the purpose from a variety of print and nonprint sources, e.g., museums, government agencies, Elders, business people, periodicals, the Internet, CD-ROMs, television, radio and surveys, using a variety of strategies; e.g., skim and scan, view, question and interview

1ED671619DC7456FBF81BC8EFC4FE1D8.description: identify potential strategies and technologies for gathering, generating and recording information; e.g., Web sites; encyclopedias; interviews; skim and scan; outlines; webs; identify key words, phrases and relevant information; take notes in point form

4BB79BBD67464979B344C0389486A030.description: use questions, discussion, reflection and other appropriate strategies to guide and monitor an inquiry or research plan

5098457CA4B045F3AE4FE20420D8E9C6.description: create an inquiry or research plan, considering a variety of factors; e.g., breadth and depth of prior knowledge, information gaps, appropriate collection tools and format, sources of information, purpose, audience, time and potential presentation form

9623E60BB11E4EA18ECEFA4F33A49C84.description: Plan an inquiry or research process and identify information needs and sources

5CD17FB63E3847BFA4FD9F96E06AD63F.description: refine the scope and direction of an inquiry by identifying the breadth and depth of the topic and the limitations, time availability, purpose, audience and form of presentation

C97432B9086D4E70A4E5938FFAE925DB.description: create categories or questions to guide an inquiry

ECB96F0957D145279AFC70584FF1C24B.description: establish a focus for text creation and determine the scope by identifying an effective, controlling idea, issue or question

20551C3F59174A4FA97742EFE6D303E2.description: identify topics for research through a variety of strategies, e.g., discussion, brainstorms and webs, considering the audience, e.g., scope and potential presentation form, and the purpose; e.g., to inform, make decisions and persuade

47DC7193BE66419D8E758274FA752C52.description: Focus on purpose and presentation form

7529B05FEF494E33BF8837078EAA869C.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to manage ideas and information.

A76F5E96BD1444AB9FBC2A649511D477.description: examine and appreciate how graphic design techniques, e.g., graphic quality, colour, sound, camera angle, lighting, composition and perspective, create and/or manipulate emotion, mood and point of view

E937A34E1DED44A681292E29DB40A33F.description: examine and appreciate the effectiveness and artistry of techniques used in texts to present emotions, ideas and information and evoke response

AE9234BECAC7437E9658BE9D275260DD.description: Appreciate the effectiveness and artistry of print and nonprint texts

E8EA5FF31B9F4D669A2795EBEFBE1234.description: examine the images in print and nonprint texts in terms of created reality and appropriateness to purpose; e.g., sensationalizing portrayals of everyday life; representation of age/gender; use of pace, music and camera angles

BEB2AB9637624452AC65FEE8D095D1E9.description: assess the settings and plots of texts in terms of created reality and plausibility

9304332126C14876991F217887DF4C41.description: assess the appropriateness of their own and others' understandings and interpretations of texts by referring to specific evidence

C25BDD69D4234163B9266DF68B9951FF.description: Evaluate the relationship to realism and the appropriateness and significance of print and nonprint texts

2F5BD1A82A6B435F896417C176EDD0CF.description: recognize Canadian content and portrayals of Canadian culture and society in print and nonprint texts

4855535A95364CDC9304BE294344232E.description: compare the choices and motives of characters/people portrayed in print and nonprint texts with themselves and others and recognize that the choices and motives presented in texts may provide insight into the behaviours of themselves and others

8A6713A1DD494C84853479A1384CD440.description: identify and consider personal moral, ethical and cultural perspectives when studying texts and reflect on how perspectives may change as a result of interpretation and discussion

0546E6FC260842BDB14788D3AFB3A038.description: Connect themselves, text, culture and environment

67E1AEF8AB6D49E99EE8101B70DB2BD9.description: Respond to a variety of print and nonprint texts

AF0F6C8A8D84425BB228FF3173E54EC5.description: identify and examine reasons for, and effectiveness of, the elements, devices and techniques used in a variety of print and nonprint texts; e.g., advertisements, music videos, films, workplace documents and Web pages

A23358DB7CB74ED89E3FC54066A3DEB0.description: recognize that elements of effective oral, visual and multimedia presentations, e.g., music, colour, lighting, movement, gesture, space and shape, are used to create specific effects

947BBE9CF9FF4BEEB5309DF84A9D7543.description: recognize the use of narrative hooks, foreshadowing, flashbacks, suspense and surprise endings to contribute to the effectiveness of plot development

D07476116CE24F188BDB4A0F356A4EA4.description: recognize the use of irony, humour, simile, metaphor, personification and symbols to contribute to a theme and to create a specific effect on the audience

A5D954F11C3B4FA1ABEFB980C00F29C2.description: Relate elements, devices and techniques to created effects

D0C95CBAAB0C4DDBA7E18B16E0B18072.description: identify organizational patterns and structural features that contribute to the purpose and content in common texts; e.g., headlines in newspapers; photographs in menus; text organizers such as tables of contents, indexes, headings and italic and boldface formatting

3A0E59456A8349F9B6A96C53A80551F6.description: recognize that some forms, structures and media are more appropriate than others in achieving a particular purpose with an intended audience; e.g., television and radio programs and advertisements use short time segments and pacing to gain and retain audience attention

A1637A0FC0F54275A94BCA5DED16AAD5.description: recognize that audience factors, e.g., gender and culture, influence form, structure and media

FFF18A0413394A17944D9B7075587B38.description: identify common text forms and their purposes, including communication forms, e.g., letters, e-mail messages and memoranda, and literary forms; e.g., poems, narratives, dramatizations and oral stories

FC21BAE1083D448CB39AD0CCDEB090E8.description: Relate form, structure and medium to purpose, audience and content

33CBB10C554748ABAC7253AF0653F763.description: Understand and appreciate textual forms, elements and techniques

01613A77F0B348EBB73D84CF40CE1896.description: use a variety of reference strategies and technologies to aid their understanding and create their own reference materials; e.g., take notes; use library catalogues; create a personalized dictionary, telephone/address books and a World Wide Web/URL address list

542715E14EBB4CA19536EE0E936D7EEB.description: record information sources in a bibliography or footnotes, accurately and completely, using a consistent and appropriate style

8B48632FD6FA458F9CF62ED6F66643AA.description: Use reference strategies and reference technologies

EE9FFCEEF32D43338F8A10CE3AEEC67B.description: recognize that past experiences influence their understandings and interpretations of texts

11DFD55021054E35B495F90CDE2C7559.description: relate their previous knowledge and experiences to enhance their understanding of new texts

DA993FA950E34E7EBA65A64710D494FA.description: identify visual elements, e.g., graphics, lists, graphs and charts, and the use of sound, e.g., music, sound effects and silence, and examine their contribution to the meaning of texts; e.g., the use of symbols and music in advertising by sports teams and food outlets

E5C676AD497E406EAAE1370C5C553A1A.description: differentiate between literal and figurative statements and/or representations, describe images developed in texts, recognize imagery in a variety of texts, e.g., advertising, comic strips, comedy in television and movies, popular music, and recognize the meaning and purpose of these statements, representations and images

422C92018DDA472FB7076AB5FA18B961.description: evaluate the effectiveness of nonverbal cues in conveying a speaker's intent

D4F85C1AEF294650AE43BC88E42D0C29.description: examine and evaluate the effectiveness of verbal cues in conveying a speaker's intent; e.g., volume, tone and mood

53B1F95000EE411FA62A11FA393FE2F2.description: paraphrase directions or messages to enhance their comprehension and complete tasks; e.g., oral directions at the workplace, assignments, manuals, diagrams, forms, lists and labels

7AD715D224C7460A89F4CBD6BEA458B6.description: apply appropriate vocabulary strategies to enhance their comprehension of oral, print and multimedia texts; e.g., word attack skills, contextual clues and dictionary skills

A9C8480145574E6E947A53B6F6835A30.description: identify and examine change in a character as a result of an event within a plot by examining elements of character, e.g., personality traits, motivation, relationships, attitudes, values, consistency of behaviour and plausibility of change, and relate a character's behaviour to their own personal experience, as appropriate

8D5FF54F99C747D496BEB66DE99FAADD.description: recognize the relationships among plot, setting, character and conflict by relating to prior knowledge, personal experience and new ideas

A83A230048F14CE88E7C9F262A9BED97.description: categorize parts of a plot using a variety of strategies, e.g., graphic organizers and technology as appropriate, including introduction, characters, setting, initial incident, rising action, climax, falling action and resolution, and assess the effectiveness of those strategies in relation to the purpose and audience

1520CFF4C2D94F8C9209EA098D7B9508.description: summarize the controlling idea, supporting ideas, details and conflicts in a text to enhance understanding

D50A135E8494470194FE3017ECDB4BBF.description: use a variety of appropriate reading strategies to enhance their comprehension of print texts; e.g., skim; read out loud; reread; form questions; make predictions; use contextual clues, graphic organizers and summarization

F14F3626048C4A15858D60AF4013A03B.description: recognize the impact that personal contexts, e.g., experience and prior knowledge, have on the construction of meaning in a text

E9925C57D46D4B309E81DC2D7E9D5A7C.description: use references to gain the historical and societal background and to enhance their understanding of specific texts; e.g., personal experiences, community leaders, teachers and Elders

E3FDBC479E0B43A4A8B13250721321CC.description: recognize that a variety of factors influence the creation of texts; e.g., constraints of time and space, audience, culture, societal norms and historical background

05AD18266AD2459AAA33CD905B8AC0D0.description: identify the key messages and features of a text that provide information about the creator's purpose and intended audience; e.g., the use of jargon, idioms, specialized workplace terminology and illustrations

032421DFF6FF4A668ECEEA7DE0CDC9A8.description: examine a variety of texts and identify their audience and purpose for creation to inform, persuade, entertain or inspire; e.g., advertisements, instruction manuals, newspapers, magazines, Web sites, CD-ROMs, music lyrics and documentary dramas

C9F48B40D8EF414E9D2B58F229B33600.description: Construct meaning from text and context

512C4935357943A49A98CCECA0E10362.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to comprehend and respond personally and critically to oral, print and other media texts.

49B2A75AB0B04726A7E9593D2F22AF52.description: demonstrate a willingness to continuously learn and grow as effective communicators

99DA223BF64D4F528691E731BB5AC5F5.description: apply strategies to increase their personal potential; e.g., set short- and long-term goals, create an action plan and build a career portfolio

B96551E166E747258AEEFA3B4392A9E3.description: create a plan to enhance language learning based on their personal goals and in relation to everyday home, community and workplace communication

29F266893E454E389CC4A81D1C4317DA.description: investigate and evaluate the language skills required to achieve attainable secondary, post-secondary and career goals, using appropriate strategies and resources; e.g., Web sites such as the Alberta Learning Information Service (ALIS) and the National Occupational Classification (NOC) system

BBF5C1C3773C4240B74F357B9854BF24.description: use guided peer and/or self-evaluation to assess their strengths and areas needing improvement, using a variety of strategies; e.g., checklists, skills inventories and discussion

55168068410C410FAA42BE62185CCB88.description: Set personal goals for language growth

8E54F97C7A1D455CA69248F9A8907AEB.description: explore and assess a range of print and nonprint texts to expand their interests, including those used in the community and the workplace; e.g., newspapers, live drama, workplace/community health information manuals and product promotional materials

C425F6AD09C0498785319E28E035C003.description: select and apply strategies to expand their interests in various text creations, e.g., Web sites, advertising and promotional texts, workplace manuals, CD-ROMs, movies and music videos, including the use of language, image, sound and structure

E6523BBE85334A01B3613EA38B2998F2.description: apply strategies to expand their interests in print and nonprint texts and text creators; e.g., sharing reading/viewing/listening inventories, discuss the role marketing plays in shaping popular culture, visit a museum or a community cultural or art centre

03A159D06A164258B368F60ACF850959.description: identify and examine the personal text preferences and other factors influencing personal preferences; e.g., purpose, interest, peers, family, heritage, advertisements and technology

3EF4DD8A32B04B26809488DB040CB3C5.description: compare their own ideas, perspectives and interpretations to those of others through a variety of strategies; e.g., discussion and pro-con/think-pair-share charts

D41A80AA3B0D423CBBDEA7603A2647DD.description: evaluate personal responses to determine the: extent of the information included in the explanation, evidence offered to support the response and degree of support for the response

6083A4BAAB914EC69804B92EC94FFC19.description: experiment with a variety of strategies, activities and resources to explore ideas, observations, opinions, experiences and emotions; e.g., exploratory talk; keep a journal; take part in a sharing circle; interview a member of the community, a local employer or a coworker

9B4F09994C2347F7BDF7B214992F709C.description: experiment with language, image and structure to create different effects for specific purposes and audiences; e.g., when creating components of a career portfolio, preparing a visual representation or completing workplace tasks

5EC53C96DFA141BBAC784B0864C2CF53.description: Experiment with language, image and structure

9CECD4B35A654E84A60536A1A60CCDC5.description: form and communicate tentative understandings, interpretations and positions on ideas and information presented in print and nonprint texts through discussion or by using various communication technologies; e.g., telephone and e-mail

BB7E379E4B8047849B3D11382C538FF8.description: experiment with strategies that contribute to the formation of tentative understandings, interpretations and positions; e.g., pose questions, discuss, keep an open mind, reread, review and recognize that texts may be inaccurate or misleading

ACA5DA7105FE42699E3A99B931074761.description: Form tentative understandings, interpretations and positions

42AFAFB0ADB4452FB79BD9B999F8356F.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to explore thoughts, ideas, feelings and experiences.
